svg.text: Every LinkedIn carousel is built from these pieces. No template should feel incomplete or empty.
Three-band corridor. Hook slide. Always slot 1.
Dark bands + Paper channel + red margin line.
Brand + call to action on dark background. Always last slide.
Corridor Dark bg, margin line at 0.6 opacity.
One idea, stated cleanly. Headline + body + emphasis.
3-5 items with numbers, titles, descriptions. Most common format.
Side-by-side A vs B. Right column in Margin Red.
Powerful quote with attribution. Authority builder.
Two concepts stacked vertically. Deeper explanation than three-up.
Three equal columns with circles, titles, descriptions.
Two-column check/X list. Very high engagement and save rate.
The big sentence. Mostly empty space. Emphasis word in red.
Hero statistic + context + source. The number dominates.
Chapter marker for transitions. Minimal. A pause.
SVG diagrams: flow, quadrant, cycle, hierarchy.

g.text: Cover → Single Concept → Single Concept → Framework → Numbered List → Comparison →
Dense build-up with framework, releases into punchline. Quote adds authority before the mic drop.
Cover → Data → Single Concept → Checklist → Punchline → Quote → CTA
Sharp and fast. Leads with a shocking stat, makes the case, drops the punchline, exits.
Cover → Single Concept → Data → Section Divider → Two-Up → Comparison →
Story arc with a natural midpoint break. Section divider creates "act 2" feeling.
Cover → Single Concept → Numbered List → Numbered List → Three-Up →
Optimized for saves and shares. List-heavy, scannable, high-value format for LinkedIn.
Cover → Single Concept → Section Divider → Numbered List → Two-Up →
Section Divider → Checklist → Three-Up → Quote → Data → Punchline → CTA
Maximum length, maximum variety. Uses section dividers to create clear chapters.
Cover + any slide types + CTA. 6-12 slides. User builds their own sequence.
All 10 content templates available. Cover and CTA locked in position.
